intro: Acronia tandapiensis, commonly known as the Tandapi acronia, is a rare flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a glossy surface. Acronia tandapiensis is adapted to thrive in humid, shaded environments with high rainfall.
